oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Selections from Eddy Arnold's Thereby Hangs A Tale album - 1959-07
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Selected performances from Eddy Arnold's Thereby Hangs A Tale album. Johnny Reb That's Me and Jesse James were recorded on July 13, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), John D. Loudermilk (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), and Buddy Harman (drums). Riders In The Sky and Boot Hill were recorded on July 21, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), Buddy Harman (drums), John D. Loudermilk (harmonica), and the Anita Kerr Singers (background vocals). The Ballad Of Davy Crockett and Partners were recorded on July 24, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), Buddy Harman (drums), and the Anita Kerr Singers (background vocals).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddy Arnold
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Eddy Arnold performs "Johnny Reb That's Me," written by Bill Graham / (2:35) Eddy Arnold performs "Riders In The Sky," written by Stan Jones / (5:22) Eddy Arnold performs "Boot Hill," written by Marge Crumbaker and Pat Wilson / (8:20) Eddy Arnold performs "Ballad Of Davy Crockett," written by George Bruns and Thomas Blackburn / (10:53) Eddy Arnold performs "Partners," written by Danny Dill / (13:10) Eddy Arnold performs "Jesse James"
